* Acquire product and program knowledge to ensure full personal capability to verbalise MillerKnoll’s differentiators and those of our products/programs against competitors.
* Gain an understanding of the furniture market and the relevant activity to build relationships with key influencers in a territory.
* Provide accurate and timely reports to the Head of Sales and ensure Salesforce is accurate, updated and utilised to its full potential on all opportunities.
* Responsibility for Forecast via SFDC.


**Company Requirements**
 Health & Safety; ensure that safe working practices are followed. Attend safety briefings, as requested. Take responsibility for your own and your co-workers safety in accordance with The Health & Safety at Work Act 1974, and The Management of Health and Safety at Work Regulation 1999
   

  

 Compliance; ensure compliance with business systems, processes, certification schemes, regulations and legislation relevant to the scope of your role. Support internal quality controls and audits to demonstrate compliance.
   

  

**Job Holder Requirements**
**Expected Competences**
* Strong interpersonal and relationship building skills
* Must demonstrate a knowledge and understanding of selling skills
* Must be able to communicate succinctly and fluently and in a compelling manner in both verbal and in written forms
* Must demonstrate high levels of drive and energy and be able to work autonomously
* Must enjoy and work well in a team when relevant
* Must be flexible to work long hours when required and prepared to make regular early starts, this position requires the individual to travel up to 50% of their time
* Must be numerate in the preparation of quotations and forecast information


**Characteristics**
* Methodical, hardworking, ambitious and energetic
* Ability to handle objections and minimise confrontation
* Articulate and diplomatic
* Honest and with high levels of integrity


**Education And Experience Requirements**
* Minimum A ‘level or higher education.
* Proven track record in generating new business for a minimum period of 3 years (or associated field).
* Driving licence (6 points maximum.)


**Who We Hire?**
 Simply put, we hire qualified applicants representing a wide range of backgrounds and abilities. MillerKnoll is comprised of people of all abilities, gender identities and expressions, ages, ethnicities, sexual orientations, veterans from every branch of military service, and more. Here, you can bring your whole self to work. We’re committed to equal opportunity employment, including veterans and people with disabilities.
   

  

 MillerKnoll complies with applicable disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact MillerKnoll Talent Acquisition at careers\_help@millerknoll.com.

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
We're building technology that transforms how restaurants work - and we're looking for someone who wants to build the team that makes it happen.
   

  

 You'll be the person who brings exceptional talent to Karma. Every hire you make will influence our culture, our capabilities, and our future. This isn't a post-and-pray role. You'll be out there hunting for the best people, building relationships before we even have open roles, and creating a candidate experience that makes people want to join us.
   

  

 You'll also keep our office at Östermalmsgatan running smoothly and help create the culture we want to be known for.
   

  

**About You**
 You're proactive, resourceful, and know how to sell a vision to people who aren't actively looking. You can juggle multiple recruitment processes without dropping the ball, and you thrive in a small, fast-moving team where priorities shift and you need to figure things out as you go.
   

  

 You learn fast and are excited to grow with us. Ideally, you have 2-3 years of hands-on recruitment experience from a startup or agency environment.
   

  

**What You'll Be Doing**
*Recruitment*
* Own and execute full-cycle recruitment for roles across the company, from Sales and Operations to Engineering and Product
* Proactively source and build relationships with top talent
* Act as a thought partner to hiring managers, advising on hiring strategy, process design, and candidate experience
* Run structured, efficient processes that are fast, fair, and focused on outcomes
* Champion an exceptional candidate experience from first outreach through onboarding
* Keep recruitment admin tight and systems up to date
* Build and nurture pipelines for critical future roles


*Office & Culture*
* Manage day-to-day office operations, incl food deliveries and keeping the office running in general
* Plan and run internal activities that bring the team together


**Why Karma?**
 You'll join at a moment when every person you bring in shapes who we become. We're 20 people now - small enough that you'll work directly with our CEO and leadership team, have real influence over our culture and see the impact of every hire.
   

  

 We believe that building a great company starts with building a great team. Not just skilled people, but people who work hard and who want to be part of something meaningful. If that's the kind of team you want to build -
 **this is your opportunity to do it!**

title: Chief Information Security Officer
description:
**A Powerful Partnership** 




 St1 Biokraft is a joint venture between St1, HitecVision, and Aneo—combining deep industrial expertise and resources to accelerate the energy transition through biogas and biomethane. Our ambition is to become the leading integrated biogas player in the Nordics and a trusted partner for customers seeking scalable, low-carbon energy solutions. We cover the entire value chain—from feedstock sourcing to production, distribution, and end-user sales—and have set ambitious targets: 3 TWh of biomethane production and 6 TWh of biomethane sales by 2030.
 



  





 To reach these goals, we are investing more than EUR 1 billion across the Nordics. Several major growth projects are underway, and our digital and operational footprint is expanding rapidly. In this context, cyber security and information security are not support functions—they are business-critical capabilities that enable safe growth, resilience, and trust.
 








  





**Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), St1 Biokraft AB, Stockholm** 




  





 As our Chief Information Security Officer (CISO), you will be responsible for developing and expanding St1 Biokraft’s security function, establishing robust governance frameworks, enhancing operational resilience, and integrating security into every aspect of our business operations and growth. This position requires comprehensive leadership encompassing strategic planning, risk management, and effective execution.
 



  





 You will collaborate with our CIO, IT, OT and business stakeholders in the Nordics, and external partners. Your main tasks are to set direction and deliver clear, fast improvements. The position is located at WTC in Stockholm.
 



  





**Your Key Responsibilities** 




 • Establish and execute the information security strategy, governance framework, policies, and security roadmap, ensuring alignment with organisational growth objectives and risk tolerance.
 



 • Establish and lead security risk management, including risk and vulnerability assessments, prioritisation, and follow-up.
 



 • Develop and sustain comprehensive incident preparedness and response capabilities—including detection, escalation, crisis communication, and recovery—in collaboration with a SOC/NOC partner.
 



 • Enhance security measures and boost operational resilience in areas such as identity and access management, network protection, endpoint security, monitoring and logging, and vulnerability management, working together with IT teams and partners.
 



 • Maintain compliance and audit readiness with applicable laws, regulations, and standards (e.g., NIS2, GDPR, and security frameworks).
 



 • Oversee third-party and supply chain security, including requirements, due diligence, contracts, and ongoing monitoring.
 



 • Promote security awareness and culture through focused training, clear leadership messaging, and straightforward guidance.
 



 • Act as a trusted adviser to management and key stakeholders—delivering decision-grade materials and recommendations that balance risk, speed, and value.
 



 • Continuously monitor the threat landscape and translate evolving threats into practical mitigations and priorities.
 



  





**Your Profile** 




 • Relevant academic background in IT, information security, engineering, or law (or equivalent competence gained through experience).
 



 • 10+ years of experience in information security, cybersecurity, risk management, or closely related domains—ideally from complex and/or regulated environments.
 



 • Strong knowledge of security frameworks such as ISO 27001, NIST, and CIS (or similar), with a proven ability to translate them into working controls and measurable outcomes.
 



 • Experience leading incident management and strengthening security operations in collaboration with internal teams and external providers.
 



 • Strong stakeholder management skills: you communicate with clarity and credibility—from technical teams to senior leadership.
 



 • High integrity, good judgement, and the ability to make fast, fact-based decisions in a scaling environment.
 



 • Certifications such as CISSP, CISM are considered a plus.
 



 • Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken.
 



  





**Our Cornerstones** 




 At St1 Biokraft, we are one team with one dream, working towards one result:
 



 • Be Collaborative – we support each other, share knowledge, and succeed together across sites, functions, and countries.
 



 • Be Open – we are curious, transparent, and eager to learn, embracing change and honest, constructive dialogue.
 



 • Be Commercial – we think and act like entrepreneurs, making fast, fact-based decisions that balance risk and reward and drive sustainable growth.
 



 • Be the Expert – we take ownership, stay close to our operations, and continuously build capabilities to deliver high quality in everything we do.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 Joining St1 Biokraft means taking a front-row seat at one of the Nordics’ fastest-growing energy companies. As CISO, you will step into a true build-and-scale role, shaping security from the ground up—setting direction, building resilience, and making a visible impact on how we protect our people, operations, and growth journey.
 



 You will work closely with senior leadership, influence priorities, and help build a security capability that enables the business—without slowing it down.
 



  





 Practicalities
 



 • Location: Stockholm
 



 • Start: As soon as possible
 



  





**Ready to Join Us?** 




 Are you ready to build a modern security capability that enables a billion-euro growth journey—and helps protect a company at the heart of the energy transition? Apply now. Please subscribe via our recruitment system (for data security reasons, we cannot accept applications by e-mail). For questions about the role, please contact Pernilla Borgström at +46 734-159855 or pernilla.borgstrom@st1biokraft.com.
 








*Please note that we have chosen to manage this recruitment ourselves and kindly ask that recruitment agencies refrain from contacting us.*

title: Sales Engineer, Moonrise
description:
Moonrise by Lunar is revolutionizing the banking industry and we're on the lookout for a Sales Engineer to join our mission! Get ready to be the technical architect behind enterprise deals. We are looking for a builder and a closer—someone who can map our standardized capabilities to complex client use cases, while simultaneously identifying gaps that will help shape the future of our product.
 





 We've spent the last 9 years in Lunar developing innovative tech and product solutions for users and businesses. Now, we are opening up our technology to fintechs, allowing them access to local accounts and payments via modern APIs. This is
 

 Moonrise by Lunar
 

 and we want you to be part of it! This role can be located in our Århus, Copenhagen or Stockholm offices. You will report to General Manager, Nanna Bergmann.
 





 We're on the hunt for an experienced
 **Sales Engineer** 
 to join Moonrise. You will work in tandem with our Sales Executives, acting as the primary technical voice during the sales cycle.
 





 While the Executive manages the commercial negotiation, you own the solution outline and technical engagement. You will be the trusted advisor to our clients' Product Heads and Developers. Our solution is a standardized platform, but every client uses our tools differently. Your goal is to deeply understand their specific use case, explain the nuance of our offering (especially regarding local clearing and payment rails), and feed those client desires back into our internal teams to drive the evolution of our platform.
 





**Here's what you'll get to do:** 




* **Partner with Sales:** 
 Work side-by-side with Sales Executives on mid- and enterprise-level deals. You own the technical discovery, ensuring we are the right fit for the client and the client is the right fit for our platform.
* **Master the Nuance:** 
 Ensure clients fully understand the capabilities and limitations of local clearing systems and payment rails. You will guide them on how to construct their payment flows using our APIs to achieve their unique business goals.
* **Interface with Builders:** 
 You will be the peer to our clients' Product Heads and Developers. You will speak their language, answer their deep architectural questions, and build trust through technical competence.
* **Shape the Roadmap:** 
 This is where the startup environment shines. You will act as the "Voice of the Market" to our internal Product and Tech teams. You will aggregate client feedback and technical requirements to help us prioritize new features and further develop our standardized solution offering.
* **Technical Evangelism:** 
 Attend events and client meetings across the Nordics and internationally, representing the technical strength of the Moonrise platform




**Here's what we're looking for:** 






 We're excited to welcome everyone to apply for this impactful role! We can’t wait to follow up with talents who we believe are the best fit based on the following criteria:
 



* **Experience:** 
 3–5 years in a technical client-facing role (Sales Engineer, Solutions Architect) ideally within fintech or payments
* **Payment Intuition:** 
 Ideally, you understand the fundamentals of how money moves (clearing, settlement, cross-border). You don't need to be a deep expert on day one, but you must be eager to master the nuances of the Nordic and European payment rails we operate on
* **Technical Fluency:** 
 Ability to read and explain REST API documentation (OpenAPI/Swagger) and confidently lead architectural discussions with developers
* **Product Strategist:** 
 You can map complex client needs to our standardized platform and effectively relay market gaps to our internal Product teams
* **Clear Communicator:** 
 You excel at translating heavy technical banking concepts into clear business value for stakeholders.




 Why join Moonrise?
 





 This role is more than just a job - it's an adventure! You'll be joining at an early stage, helping shape the future of Moonrise. We're offering an unmatched opportunity to navigate new territory, take ownership, and make a real impact.
 





 Ready to blast off with Moonrise by Lunar?
 





**Curious about the Lunar culture? 💚** 






 Everything at Lunar centers around our core - to challenge. It’s infused into our four values and guides us in how to work together, lead projects, and lead people to reach our mission. Our values aren't just words on a page - they're what make us who we are and shape the vibe of our culture. And trust me, we’re all about the vibe. For a longer read about our culture,
 

**click here** 


 .
 





**Are you ready to join the journey? Apply now and let's find out more!** 






 While you hold on tight for us to get back to you, curious to see what we’re up to? Follow us on
 

**LinkedIn** 


 for business announcements and releases 📢, check out our
 

**Instagram** 


 for an inside scoop on what it’s like to work here 📸, and visit our
 

**blog** 


 for the latest tech and product insights! 📱🫰
 





*Depending on the regulations in the country where you will be employed, we will ask to see or obtain information about your criminal record.*

title: Senior Projektledare
description:
**Information om rollen** 




 Stelltec växer! Med en stark efterfrågan på våra konsulter rekryterar vi flera projektledare under 2025. Primärt letar vi efter projektledare med ett tekniskt kunnande som kan leverera IT-projekt inom olika industrier. Viktiga krav är din förmåga att kunna hantera end-to-end-projekt självständigt, med erfarenhet inom områden som t.ex. affärssystem, e-handel eller masterdatahantering. Stelltec letar efter kandidater som inte bara kan leverera tekniska projekt eller verka i agila leveransmiljöer, utan också kan bidra till vår tillväxt och kultur!
 



  





**Krav för rollen** 



* Rollen kräver en projektledare med erfarenhet av projektleverans från början till slut, särskilt att hantera projekt självständigt, vanligtvis med team på 15-20 personer.
* Du bör ha erfarenhet av att avgränsa och driva projekt från början till slut, med fokus på lösningsdesign, upphandling, utveckling, implementering, testning samt utrullning.
* Viktiga tekniska expertområden inkluderar t.ex. affärssystem, e-handel, masterdata (PIM/PCM) och digitalt innehåll (CMS) där vi ser positivt på att våra kandidater har arbetat inom flera områden.
* Ideala kandidater bör kunna skapa projektplaner, hantera uppskattningar och estimat, hantera leverantörs- och systemintegratörsrelationer och effektivt kommunicera med ledande befattningshavare på styrgruppsnivå.
* Rollen kräver teknisk skicklighet i att leverera komplexa projekt, med tonvikt på att kunna ta projekt live och visa konkreta affärsresultat.
* Kandidater bör ha erfarenhet av konsultmiljöer, med förmåga att arbeta över olika projekttyper och tekniska landskap.
* Stark kommunikationsförmåga är avgörande, särskilt när det gäller att rapportera komplexa projektdetaljer till intressenter på ledningsnivå.



  





**Vad Vi Kan Erbjuda Dig** 



* Möjligheten att vara med och skapa och forma en helt ny verksamhet. Vi är ett ungt och litet företag så för den som vill så finns det massor att engagera sig i. Vill man helt fokusera på sin konsultroll så går det naturligtvis också bra!
* Möjlighet att arbeta med prestigefyllda uppdrag hos etablerade svenska och internationella företag samt start-ups. Dessa uppdrag annonseras sällan då kandidaterna handplockas – där du blir stjärnan.
* Chansen att arbeta med seniora yrkesverksamma från IT-konsultvärlden samt datakonsulter, managementkonsulter och alla aspekter av Newground Alliance.
* Bli en del av en stark befintlig allians av konsultföretag som kombinerar stabilitet och leveranssäkerhet med dynamik, en äkta start-up-känsla och framför allt erfarenhet. Stelltec är ett kunskapsbolag och vi är aldrig starkare än våra konsulter och hur vi kan dela erfarenhet och kunskap mellan oss.
* Ett fantastiskt kontor på Norrmalmstorg i Stockholm där sociala sammankomster, kunskapsdelning, sportaktiviteter och intressanta träningsmöjligheter är vardag.
* Attraktiva, konkurrenskraftiga och flexibla kompensationspaket som matchar din erfarenhet, din situation och dina behov.



  





**Hos Stelltec får du …** 




 …vara med och utveckla ett innovativt och nytänkande företag från start. Du handplockas till spännande uppdrag hos både svenska och internationella företag där din kunskap och genomförandekraft är avgörande. Samtidigt blir du en del av Newground Alliance – en stark allians av etablerade konsultbolag inom olika nischer. Här får du möjlighet att samarbeta, utvecklas och dela kunskap med över 250 erfarna konsulter.
 



 Våra konsulter bidrar med stor erfarenhet, djup kunskap och insikt i vad som krävs för att framgångsrikt genomföra programvaru-, plattforms- och teknikimplementeringar. Stelltec har den kompetens som våra kunder behöver för att få momentum, driva affärsvärde och uppnå fantastiska resultat genom att göra det möjligt för sin tekniska organisation att lyckas.
 



 Oavsett om Stelltec tar sig an en digital re-platforming, ett molntransformationsprojekt eller digitalisering av viktiga affärsprocesser, får vi det att hända på ett snabbt, effektivt och kostnadseffektivt sätt. Hantering av projekt, initiativ eller andra leveransfokuserade arbetsflöden är hjärtat i vår verksamhet, och vi tvekar aldrig att ta risker för att bevisa vårt värde.
 



 Läs mer på www.stelltec.se.
 



  





**Vi ingår i Newground Alliance** 




 Newground Alliance är en allians av oberoende nischkonsultbolag som tillsammans skapar värdefulla synergieffekter. Alla bolag är ”sina egna” och drivs självständigt, men som konsult har du möjligheter att samverka med konsulter från övriga bolag, ta hjälp av experter och utbyta kunskap. Alla bolagen delar lokaler på Norrmalmstorg vilket skapar spontana och värdefulla möten i vardagen.
 



 We are a consulting company focused on IT delivery management. We are a team of experienced, delivery-focused IT consultants with the skills, know-how and passion for taking on our clients’ most challenging projects – maximizing the value of their IT investments. Read more at www.stelltec.se

title: Software Engineer - Backend
description:
SAVR is a fast-growing Swedish fintech company on a mission to reinvent investing. We empower investors with a platform that offers
 **lower fees** 
 ,
 **greater transparency** 
 , and a
 **radically improved experience** 
 .
 



  





 We’re not just building another investment service — we’re reimagining how financial products should work for people, not just institutions. As part of our ambitious, innovative and curious team, you’ll help shape the future of investing in Sweden and beyond.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Software Engineer in our Backend team, you are part of our tech team based in Stockholm or Halmstad. You will be a part of building and developing the next generation investment platform. Your role involves close collaboration with fellow Software Engineers, as well as with Data Scientists, Product Designers and Product Managers.
 



  





 Your work will be managed and supported by our Tech Team Lead. Our tech stack consists of Terraform, PHP (Laravel), Python, Snowflake, DBT, Kotlin , SQL, and is hosted on AWS.
 



  





**Your Mission** 



* Build Software Features in a fast paced environment
* Drive ideas and develop concepts from a tech perspective
* Contribute towards improving our tech stack, architecture, and operational methods
* Collaborate and build high-quality products by following good engineering practices
* Develop integrations to third-party API's
* Embrace our learning culture by both receiving and providing feedback, and be open to getting constructive feedback on your code



  





**You’ll Thrive in This Role If You...** 



* Are a motivated engineer with a passion for software development and Infrastructure
* Recognize the importance of collaboration in order to build a great product, and enjoys engaging with colleagues to exchange ideas and concepts
* Have 4+ years professional team-based software development experience
* Are a team player who is open to everyone’s opinions
* Are fluent in English
* Have experience from working in a scalable, product-based environment
* Are either a Swedish citizen or holds a valid EU work permit. Unfortunately, we cannot offer visa sponsorship for this role



  





 If you possess a different profile but believe you have relevant skills and can excel in this role, we encourage you to apply and share your motivation with us.
 



  





**Our Cultural DNA** 




 At SAVR, we’re:
 



 🧠
 **Open-minded** 
 – we embrace new ideas, diverse perspectives, and continuous learning
 



 🚀
 **Bold** 
 – we take smart risks, move fast, and aren’t afraid to fail forward
 



 🤝
 **Honest** 
 – we value transparency, feedback, and doing the right thing
 



  





 We’re a startup, so things can be a little messy — and that’s part of the thrill. If you thrive in building as a team and handling uncertainty, you will fit right in.
 



  





**What’s In It for You** 




 You’ll join a product- and design-driven company where your work has real impact. We keep things lean, move fast, and genuinely care about the experience we deliver — for customers and for each other.
 



  





 Here’s what we offer:
 



 💻 Top-tier work gear
 



 💰 Competitive salary
 



 🏃 ♀️ Generous wellness allowance
 



 🤒 Insurance package
 



 🌱 Occupational pension and long-term savings support
 



 🏢
 *Office-first approach* 
 to foster collaboration and quick decision-making — with flexibility when you need it (4+1)
 



 🥗
 *Stocked pantry* 
 , plus regular social gatherings and wellness activities to keep energy and culture high
 



  





**Our Commitment to Diversity** 




 SAVR is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people from all backgrounds, identities, and experiences. We believe diverse teams build better products and are committed to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive.
 



  





**Ready to Join Us?** 




 We’d love to hear from you. Apply now or reach out with any questions — and let’s build something meaningful together.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**We're Playground Dev** 




 We're a small, sharp engineering team in Stockholm. We build modern backend and fullstack systems for our clients using solid engineering practices, cloud-native tools and applied AI as a natural part of our technical landscape.
 



  





**About the role** 




 This role is focused on delivering high-quality software engineering in client projects. You'll work hands-on with designing, building and operating production systems, taking responsibility for architecture, code quality and long-term maintainability.
 



  





**You'll love this if you** 



* Have 5+ years of experience building software systems
* Enjoy owning problems end to end and shaping technical solutions
* Are comfortable working with modern backend stacks and cloud platforms
* Like collaborating closely with other engineers and clients
* Are based in Stockholm and fluent in Swedish
* Have an interest in AI and how it can be applied in real systems



  





**What we offer** 



* Meaningful engineering work with real impact
* A team with strong expertise in AI and applied AI engineering
* Continuous skill development through hands-on work with experienced engineers
* A sustainable pace and healthy work-life balance

title: Systemutvecklare PHP/Laravel till JENSEN Education (visstid)
description:
EdTech är ett spännande och växande område inom systemutveckling. Inom detta område driver JENSEN education utvecklingen med vår egenutvecklade lärplattform Campus. Vi söker nu en engagerad och erfaren utvecklare för en projektanställning med fokus på att stärka upp och förvalta våra befintliga system.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som drivs av att lösa komplexa problem i etablerad kodbas och som vill bidra till ett meningsfullt syfte där tusentals elever ges bättre chans att lyckas med sina studier.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som utvecklare hos oss kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att säkerställa stabiliteten i vår lärplattform. Din huvuduppgift blir att arbeta med vår PHP-baserade miljö, där fokus ligger på buggfixar, felsökning och stabilisering av äldre system.
   

  

 Du blir en del av JENSEN IT-utvecklingsteam som ansvarar för våra interna datasystem samt utbildnings mjukvaran Campus. Våra system används dagligen av 26 000 användare, vilket ställer höga krav på att vår befintliga kod fungerar felfritt och effektivt.
   

  

**I den här rollen kommer du att:**
* Identifiera, analysera och åtgärda buggar i komplexa PHP-miljöer.
* Arbeta med underhåll av äldre system för att säkra driften.
* Optimera befintlig kod och databasfrågor för att förbättra stabilitet och prestanda.
* Arbeta nära produktägare och teamet i ett agilt flöde (Scrum).
* Vara en del av något större – din förmåga att lösa tekniska problem påverkar direkt 26 000 användare vardag.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av professionell systemutveckling i PHP Laravel.
* Stor vana av att arbeta med äldre system (legacy) och en god förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i befintlig kodbas.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av buggfixning och felsökning.
* God vana av att arbeta med SQL-databaser (MySQL).
* En lösningsorienterad och noggrann inställning – du trivs med att gå till botten med tekniska problem.


**Vi tror att du har:**
* Erfarenhet av EdTech eller liknande stora administrativa system.
* Kunskap inom andra delar av vår stack (t ex.Angular/Typescript).
* Erfarenhet av versionhantering i Git.


**Anställningsform**
 Tjänsten är en tidsbegränsad anställning på heltid med start snarast eller enligt överenskommelse till slutet av juni 2026.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Vi sitter i ljusa, trevliga och moderna lokaler centralt i Gamla stan, Stockholm. På huvudkontoret arbetar cirka 30 medarbetare och chefer varav 9 personer med verksamheternas IT-miljö.
   

  

**Din ansökan**
 Du ansöker genom att registrera din profil och bifoga ditt CV och andra relevanta dokument. Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via webben, ansökningar som kommer in på annat sätt behandlas inte. Urval sker löpande så skicka in din ansökan redan idag, dock senast den 27/2-2026 . Tillsättning av tjänst kan komma att ske innan sista ansökningsdagen. Mer information om vår rekryteringsprocess hittar du på vår hemsida under lediga tjänster.
   

  

 Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester för kandidater som går vidare till ett senare skede, och vi ber då även om ett utdrag ur belastningsregistret.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten och hur det är att jobba hos oss, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Andreas Külekci på andreas.kulekci@jenseneducation.se.
   

  

 Samtal/mejl från externa rekryteringsföretag och säljare undanbedes.
   

  

 Låter det intressant? Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 JENSEN education är ett av Sveriges största privata utbildningsföretag med förtroendet att utbilda drygt 17 000 elever inom fem olika områden – förskola, grundskola, gymnasium, vuxenutbildning samt yrkeshögskola. JENSEN grundades 1996 av Håkan Jensen, företagets vd och ägare, och står för långsiktighet, kvalitet och ansvarstagande. Utbildningskonceptet ”Träning för verkligheten och bildning som mål” genomsyrar all verksamhet.

title: Guest Service Agent til First Camp
description:
**Er du redderen i nøden, når receptionen er overbelastet?**
 Kan du jonglere telefonopkald, e-mails og chat med overskud? Har du desuden fingerspidsfornemmelse og evnen til at finde den bedste løsning for hver gæst? Så kan du være vores næste stjerne i First Camps Guest Service.
   

  

**Hvem er First Camp?**
 Vores mål er klart – vi vil være verdens førende campingkæde. For at nå dertil skal vi levere enestående gæsteservice. Uden vores serviceorienterede medarbejdere i Contact Centeret er det umuligt. First Camp vokser, og vi har brug for flere kollegaer til vores skandinaviske Contact Center i Göteborg.
   

  

**Hvad indebærer rollen?**
 Som kundeservicemedarbejder i First Camps Guest Service spiller du en afgørende rolle. Din opgave er at besvare telefonopkald, e-mails, chat og henvendelser via sociale medier fra vores gæster. Du hjælper både privatpersoner og virksomheder.
   

  

 En stor del af din rolle handler om at skabe merværdi. Vi ønsker, at du er proaktiv og guider vores gæster til bedre løsninger, end de selv havde tænkt. Derfor er det vigtigt, at du har godt kendskab til vores forskellige tilbud og produkter.
   

  

**Hvem søger vi?**
 Vi leder efter dig, der har erfaring med salg og kundeservice samt er vant til at tale i telefon. Du kommunikerer flydende på dansk eller et andet skandinavisk sprog og har stærke IT-kompetencer. Kendskab til engelsk & tysk er et ekstra plus.
   

  

 Vi værdsætter personlige egenskaber og søger kollegaer med en høj grad af service. Du skal sætte pris på varierede dialoger med gæster og trives med at bruge telefonen som dit vigtigste redskab. For at sikre høj gæstetilfredshed er grundighed, nysgerrighed, lydhørhed og engagement vigtige egenskaber.
   

  

**Hvad tilbyder vi?**
 Hos First Camp er der mange, der er startet i din stilling og siden har gjort karriere i virksomheden. Du får mulighed for at udvikle dig, lære nye ting og møde mennesker fra hele verden. Vores fælles værdier styrer vores daglige arbejde:
   

  

**We Care:** 
 Vi arbejder sammen med omtanke for gæsten, kollegaen og planeten. Vi skaber et åbent og støttende miljø, hvor vi udfordrer hinanden, lærer af fejl og fejrer succeser.
   

  

**We Have Fun:** 
 Ved at være os selv og have det sjovt sammen skaber vi en imødekommende stemning for alle, vi møder. Sammen skaber vi gode minder for vores teams, kollegaer og gæster.
   

  

**We Simplify:** 
 Fremdrift og lysten til at lære gør, at vi konstant forbedrer og udvikler vores arbejdsmetoder. Vi gør det nemt for hinanden – det skal være let at gøre det rigtige for både kollegaer og gæster.
   

  

**We Deliver Results:** 
 Vi fokuserer i alt, hvad vi gør, på at skabe resultater for vores gæster, kollegaer og hele virksomheden. Målsætningerne er ambitiøse, og vi lykkes bedst, når vi bruger både hjerte og hjerne.
   

  

 Vi tilbyder en arbejdsplads med gode udviklingsmuligheder og omsorgsfulde kollegaer, der deler både erfaringer og latter. Sammen ønsker vi at fortsætte vores succeshistorie og vokse med flere stjerner, der vil være med til at forme vores fremtid.
   

  

**Vilkår**
 Vi søger medarbejdere til sommersæsonen med varierende arbejdstid. Arbejdstiderne varierer og kan inkludere aftener og weekender.
   

  

 Ansøgning
   

  

 Vi gennemfører udvælgelse og samtaler løbende, så søg allerede i dag.
   

  

 Vi arbejder kompetencebaseret i vores rekrutteringer og fokuserer på at finde den person, der bedst matcher stillingens kravprofil.
   

  

 For slutkandidater kan vi anmode om straffeattest og eventuelt børneattest.
   

  

 Som det første skridt i vores udvælgelsesproces vil du skulle gennemføre en kort rekrutteringstest, som hjælper os med at sikre en retfærdig og præcis matchning.
   

  

 Dette kan være begyndelsen på noget fantastisk. Vi ser frem til din ansøgning!

title: Forward Deployed Engineer - Agentic AI
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 As a Forward Deployed Engineer in Agentic AI at Kyndryl, you’ll help shape the future of advanced Agentic AI while working with a team that’s leading the industry.
   

  

 We're solving real-world problems at a massive scale powered by creativity, precision, and a shared obsession with what’s next.
   

  

 You’ll be part of a team of Data Scientists shaping the future of Agentic AI - architecting and scaling a next-gen open-source framework that powers autonomous systems across industries.
   

  

**We're not just talking innovation - we're
 *building* 
 it. Fast** 
 .
   

  

* You’ll work with autonomy, follow your own leads, and build real systems – not tickets.
* Tech-first, action-oriented culture: think in code. Rapid demo cycles, collaborative peer pairing, and framework rollouts in weeks.
* Direct impact at scale: drive Kyndryl as an AI-native company - your ideas and IP shape the transformation.
* Work that matters: customer-first, innovation-always. Balance advanced programming with strategic thinking and client interaction.
* True builder’s environment: collaborate with top-tier talent (most of the team holds PhDs). Everyone contributes equally - ideas over titles.


**What You’ll Do**
* Serve as the bridge between deep technical work and business transformation, solving meaningful challenges through Agentic AI.
* Work on a modular, open-source Agentic AI framework - integrating GenAI and real-world tools.
* Develop, train, and deploy intelligent agents using tools like Python, Azure ML, focused on dynamic, self-improving systems.
* Translate business needs into data science problems with autonomy - then rapidly experiment, build, and deploy solutions that scale.
* Co-own the evolution of the Agentic AI framework - not just code, but also architecture, design, product thinking, and client success.
* Mentor and inspire a new generation of researchers and developers from PhD students to business leaders, with your contributions credited and published.


**Your Future at Kyndryl**
 We don’t hire for a role - we hire for a journey. You’ll be empowered to work remotely, flexibly, and at your best. Your success is measured by what you create, not where you work from. Expect an innovation cycle where you’ll build a legacy portfolio and help reimagine what AI can do for business.
   

  

**Who You Are**
**Must-have capabilities**
* Hands-on Agentic AI / GenAI engineering exposure - building or contributing to frameworks, not just using APIs
* Strong programming fluency (Python) and architectural design (e.g., microservice ecosystems, message brokers)
* Minimum 5+ years of experience coding in Python, with proven ability to develop robust, scalable solutions
* Ability to operate independently and collaborate within a high-trust, low-hierarchy team
* Contributions to technical communities and shaping open-source projects


**Preferred Certifications And/or Experience**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent research experience in computer science, mathematics, AI, or a related field
* Certifications in Azure, AWS, or Google ML platforms
* Demonstrated contributions to graph theory, DevOps, or distributed systems
* Previous projects involving digital transformation, AI-native product development, or enterprise automation


**Apply now if you’re ready to shape the future of AI.**
 Let’s redefine what’s possible. Together.
   

  

 #AgenticAI
   

  

**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Procurement Manager
description:
Country: Sweden
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **Procurement Manager** 
 to join our Nordic procurement team, working closely with Sourcing colleagues based in Norway and Sweden. In this role, you will be responsible for sourcing to Nordic locations, collaborating with stakeholders across all Nordic countries as well as managing relationships with global vendors.
   

  

 You will contribute to strategic sourcing, supplier management, and continuous improvement initiatives in a cross-border, multicultural environment, ensuring efficient, compliant, and value-creating procurement processes that support our Nordic business operations.
   

  

 As a
 **Procurement Manager** 
 , you will take an important role in the team supporting selected areas in the bank with Procurement related tasks. You will take lead in simplification & standardization initiatives to optimize the procurement process, ensuring swift and secure handling of the bank’s purchases.
   

  

 Working in a highly regulated environment raises the stakes, and we need to work closely with our suppliers in complex value chains. This is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to be working alongside and learn from senior professionals of different cultures and a multitude of competencies.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities for the role:**
* Support for business functions in sourcing activities to secure service quality and cost effectiveness
* Work collaboratively coordinating sourcing activities between the respective stakeholders (e.g. legal & compliance, IT / security and cost management)
* You will take lead in negotiations and RFP processes with material vendors within dedicated area
* Collaborate with the procurement team to ensure optimal lead time in procurement processes
* Secure compliance with the Nordic sourcing policies and governance within all business functions
* Secure commercially healthy sourcing agreements supporting business growth
* Be Nordic point of contact for vendors within dedicated area
* Support in the development and improvement of processes and procedures in Sourcing
* Promote sourcing awareness within Nordics
* Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to establish, monitor, and ensure compliance with contractual agreements and Service Level Agreements (SLAs)
* Monitor ongoing vendor performance


**Skills & Requirements**
 To succeed in this role, we believe that you have the following qualifications and/or experience:
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in technology, business, finance, political science, law, statistics, or equivalent (or documented relevant working experience in related fields)
* Experience within procurement & procurement processes in the Nordics
* Good teamworking skills and experience from working across functions
* Good presentation skills and experience from addressing senior management
* Structured and with attention to details
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to manage multiple priorities and projects in parallel
* Fluent English verbal and written communication skills and we also expect fluent in Norwegian or Swedish.


**For further information and application deadline**
 Regarding this position, please contact Ricky Jonsson, Head of Sourcing, by telephone +46 (0)73 046 58 39.
   

  

 Interviews will be conducted on rolling basis and application deadline is 15 February 2026.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 We perform background checks on all relevant candidates. For positions that require authorization and/or confirmation of suitability, a police certificate of good conduct and credit check must be presented. Background check is carried out with prior consent from the candidate.

title: BI Analyst
description:
Vill du jobba nära affären och vara den som levererar beslutsunderlag som gör verklig skillnad? Hos Hemfrid är BI en central del av hur verksamheten styrs, prioriteras och utvecklas. Gazella rekryterar nu en BI Analyst som vill ta ett tydligt ansvar för analys och uppföljning inom ett affärsområde med högt tempo och stora ambitioner. Rollen innebär ett nära samarbete med affärsområdesledning, verksamhetsansvariga och centrala funktioner inom Cleaning, samt ett tätt samarbete med internationella kollegor och koncernens dataorganisation. Här får du kombinera din analytiska förmåga med affärssinne och bidra till Hemfrids fortsatta utveckling.
 



  





 Låter det intressant? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag – urval sker löpande!
 



  





**Vad Hemfrid erbjuder dig** 




 Hemfrid ser att en bra arbetsplats handlar mer om bara arbete – det handlar om att vara en del av något större. Här kommer du till en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där dina idéer verkligen gör skillnad. Hemfrid värdesätter sin företagskultur som bygger på samarbete och öppenhet. Du blir en del av ett tight och engagerat team i ett entreprenöriellt bolag, där du får möjlighet att både bidra och utvecklas.
 



  





 Rollen är placerad i Hemfrids fina lokaler i centrala Stockholm på Tulegatan med möjlighet till flexibilitet.
 



  





**Din utmaning** 




 I rollen som BI Analyst ansvarar du för att samla in, strukturera, analysera och visualisera data från olika källor (varav Salesforce är en av de primära källorna) samt omsätta analysen till tydliga beslutsunderlag för affären. Här arbetar du enligt SAFe-ramverket (Scaled Agile Framework), vilket innebär att du bidrar till en synkroniserad leveransmodell som skapar värde inte bara för Cleaning utan för hela koncernen. I denna roll har du även många kontaktytor både internationellt och inom den interna organisationen. Du rapporterar till Head of Business Control Cleaning.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter:** 




  




* Utveckla, underhålla och vidareutveckla rapporter och dashboards i Power BI för uppföljning av affärsområdet Cleaning
* Underhålla och utveckla datalager, datamodellering och datakvalitet
* Sammanställa och analysera affärsdata kopplat till exempelvis:
* – Kund- och volymutveckling
* – Operativ effektivitet och produktivitet
* Fungera som stöd till verksamheten i tolkning av data och identifiering av förbättrings- och affärsmöjligheter
* Samverka med IT, Finance och andra funktioner kring datakällor, affärssystem och rapporteringsstruktur
* Delta i utveckling och förbättring av KPI:er, uppföljningsmodeller och beslutsstöd
* Säkerställa att analyser och rapporter är affärsnära, tillförlitliga och användarvänliga
* Fungera som den primära länken mellan affärsområdet Cleaning och den centrala koncernens datateam för att säkerställa att lokala rapporteringslösningar är i linje med koncernövergripande datastyrning och infrastruktur.
* Delta aktivt i SAFe (PI-planering, systemdemonstrationer m.m.) och samarbeta med andra team för att säkerställa att dataleveranser integreras i det bredare koncerngemensamma värdeflödet.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som har en kandidatexamen inom IT eller ekonomi, alternativt en civilingenjörsexamen, där examen på masternivå ses som meriterande. Vi ser att du har ca 3–4 års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, gärna från tjänste-, service- eller konsumentnära verksamhet.
 



  





 Du har arbetat affärsnära, med fördel i en större koncernmiljö och har erfarenhet av att ta fram och presentera analyser för beslutsfattare. Vidare har du grundläggande ekonomiska kunskaper, såsom resultat- och kostnadsuppföljning. Du har goda kunskaper i Power BI, inklusive DAX och datamodellering, samt erfarenhet av att arbeta med data från affärssystem (t.ex. ERP, CRM eller liknande). Erfarenhet av IFS är meriterande.
 



  





 Då du kommer att kommunicera på svenska och engelska på daglig basis, kommunicerar du obehindrat i så väl tal som skrift på båda språk. Slutligen har du förståelse för Databricks, datalager, ETL-flöden och databasstrukturer, och kunskaper i SQL eller liknande frågespråk ses som en fördel.
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper** 




 För att trivas i rollen som BI Analyst hos Hemfrid ser vi att du är en analytisk och strukturerad person med stark problemlösningsförmåga. Du är affärsorienterad och nyfiken på verksamhetens behov. Vidare är du kommunikativ och pedagogisk med förmåga att förklara komplex data på ett enkelt sätt. Du är en stark kommunikatör som kan navigera i samspelet mellan lokala verksamhetsbehov och centrala koncernkrav. Dessutom trivs du att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team likväl som självständigt – där du driver ditt arbete framåt.
 



  





**Om Hemfrid och KEYTO Group** 




 Hemfrid är en del av KEYTO Group och är Sveriges största leverantör av hemnära tjänster. Sedan 1996 har vi hjälpt människor att få en enklare och mer hållbar vardag, med tjänster inom städning, trädgård, hantverk och installation av hushållsapparater.
 



  





 Vi är fler än 4 500 medarbetare i Sverige och Storbritannien och växer ständigt, både genom nya tjänster och smarta förvärv. Hos oss får du jobba i ett företag där din insats verkligen gör skillnad – både för kunderna och för teamet runt dig. Vi satsar på engagemang, utveckling och trygghet, och erbjuder en arbetsmiljö där det är enkelt att växa, ta ansvar och trivas.
 



  





 Att arbeta hos oss innebär att du blir en del av ett starkt och inkluderande team, där varje dag bjuder på nya utmaningar och möjligheter att göra livet lite enklare för andra – och där du själv utvecklas tillsammans med företaget.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Vill du vara med på Hemfrids fortsatta tillväxtresa och passar på ovan profil? Ansök redan idag via ansök-knappen, då ansökningar hanteras löpande! Vi har ej möjlighet att ta emot ansökningar via mail. I den här rekryteringen samarbetar Hemfrid med Gazella som partner. Har du frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Malin Täckdal Thörnroth (malin.tackdal@gazella.se) som är ansvarig rekryterare för denna tjänst.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Dometic is a global leader in outdoor living solutions, providing essential gear for an adventurous lifestyle. We are on an exciting growth and transformation journey – now looking for our next star – a passionate Data Engineer who will help us advance our global data platform and drive adoption across the organization.
   

  

**About The Position**
 As a
 **Senior Data Engineer** 
 in our Data & AI Office, you’ll play a key role in shaping and scaling our Snowflake-based data platform. This is a position for someone who combines strong technical skills with curiosity, collaboration, and a genuine interest in understanding the business context behind the data. You’ll work closely with global teams and senior stakeholders, contributing to a shared vision and translating business needs into robust, scalable solutions while helping shape how we work with data as the platform evolves.
   

  

**We’re looking for someone** 
 who enjoys working with people as much as technology, thrives in cross-functional environments, and approaches stakeholder collaboration with openness and trust. If you’re motivated by influence, mentorship, and growing into a leadership role over time, this position provides a supportive environment and a strong foundation for that journey.
   

  

 As a
 **Senior** 
**Data Engineer** 
 in our
 **Data & AI Office** 
 , you’ll play a key role in shaping and scaling our Snowflake-based data platform. This is a position for someone who is not only technically skilled but also curious about the business and eager to make an impact. You’ll collaborate with global teams and senior stakeholders to translate business needs into robust, scalable solutions—designing integrations, optimizing pipelines, and influencing architectural standards as the platform evolves.
   

  

 We’re looking for someone who enjoys working with people as much as technology, thrives in cross-functional environments, and approaches stakeholder collaboration with openness and trust. If you’re motivated by influence, mentorship, and growing into a leadership role over time, this position provides a supportive environment and a strong foundation for that journeyWe’re looking for someone who thrives in stakeholder management and enjoys working cross-functionally. If you’re also interested in developing into a leadership role in the future, this position offers a great foundation for that growth.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities**
* Collaborate closely with stakeholders to translate business needs into scalable, future-proof solutions
* Contribute to data engineering standards with ways of working and best practices
* Design and build efficient data pipelines and workflows that power analytics and insights
* Integrate systems by setting up and maintaining reliable connections between source systems and the data platform
* Analyze and map source data to ensure accurate and consistent information flow
* Monitor and resolve data incidents, safeguarding quality and integrity across the platform


**What do we offer?**
 You are offered an interesting role in a dynamic, fast paced and global environment with great opportunities to grow, evolve with the company and take on new challenges.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**A suitable background would be** 
 at least 5 years' experience from analytical solutions or platforms. You have a solid experience within data engineering and analytics – and you are most likely coming from a consulting background, now ready to take the next step: join a global company, lead initiatives, and make a long-term impact. You also have the following qualifications and experiences:
   

  

* Proven ability to drive projects – You’ve led initiatives or taken ownership of deliverables, even without formal project management titles.
* Strong SQL and data modeling expertise – You know how to design efficient structures and write optimized queries for complex data environments.
* Beneficial experience with modern tools – Familiarity with Snowflake, Python, Azure services, Azure DevOps, and PowerShell will give you an edge.
* Language skills – Fluent in English (spoken and written); Swedish proficiency is an advantage.


**To be successful in this role, we believe that you possess the following skills, competencies & characteristics:**
* Curious and eager to learn – You embrace new technologies and approaches, while keeping sight of how they fit into the bigger business picture.
* Analytical and pattern-oriented – You can connect the dots across complex data landscapes, spotting trends and opportunities for improvement.
* Leadership skills - You are a natural leader, and even if you lack formal leadership experience - you have the ability to create enthusiasm and focus in a team
* Strategic thinker – You design solutions that scale, anticipate future needs, and continuously drive efficiency and innovation.
* Excellent communicator and stakeholder manager – You translate technical concepts into clear business language and build strong relationships across global teams.
* Strong business acumen – You understand the impact of data on decision-making and earn trust by aligning solutions with business priorities.


**Dometic's Core Values**
 To thrive and succeed in this role, you understand the importance of our core values – Together We build our future, We play to win, We embrace change and We walk the talk; these values reflect the heart and soul of Dometic and they define what it takes to work here and how we do things.
   

  

 Dometic operates with a 4+1 policy, 4 days per week in the office and the possibility to work 1 day per week remotely. We see the social aspect of being in the office, meeting colleagues, having short coffee break interactions or a quick face to face meeting as key to success as we become more productive and fast paced in terms of problem solving, learning, cross functional collaboration and not the least in a way to have fun at work!
   

  

**Are you our next star?** 
 Then we would love to see your application. Selection is being made on a running basis. If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Anna Allert, Talent Acquisition at anna.allert@dometic.com
   

  

 In this recruitment, personality and logical test will be used as part of the process.

title: Learning & Performance Specialist – Tech
description:
*Vill du vara med och forma framtidens kompetenser inom Tech och AI? Hos oss får du ett otroligt viktigt uppdrag med stort handlingsutrymme och möjlighet att påverka och utforma rollen framåt. Vi står inför en spännande förändringsresa och söker dig som vill bygga starka samarbeten med hela organisationen för att bygga lärande som stärker prestationer i vardagen. I rollen får du arbeta både strategiskt och operativt i ett engagerat team med breda kontaktytor. Inledningsvis ligger ett särskilt fokus på kontinuerlig upskilling inom AI, data, molntjänster, IT-säkerhet och lean-agil metodik.*
**Om jobbet**
 I rollen ansvarar du för att identifiera, prioritera och omsätta tech- och upskillingbehov till relevanta, engagerande och effektfulla lärandeinitiativ. Det innebär både att sätta riktning och att själv bidra operativt där det behövs.
   

  

 Du blir en del av Learning & Performance inom People & Culture på Länsförsäkringar AB, och arbetar i praktiken mycket nära vår breda IT- och Tech-organisation. Det inkluderar utvecklingsteam, arkitekter, data- och AI-funktioner, IT-säkerhet, cloud och lean-agila ledare. Genom ett nära partnerskap med interna stakeholders jobbar du för att säkerställa att våra satsningar på lärande inom Tech-området är strategiskt relevanta och bidrar till långsiktig framgång.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 Dina arbetsuppgifter omfattar bland annat att:
   

  

* Driva kompetensförflyttning inom Tech och AI, från behovsanalys till genomförande som skapar engagemang och effekt både brett i organisationen och riktat mot Tech-specialister.
* Följa upp och mäta effekter av insatser, och använda data och insikter för att styra och prioritera lärande.
* Stötta chefer i att utveckla lärande team och integrera lärande i det dagliga arbetet.
* Fungera som sammanhållande länk mellan People & Culture och Tech-organisationen i frågor som rör kompetensförsörjning.
* Självständigt och i nära samverkan med intressenter utveckla material, implementera lösningar samt bidra operativt, exempelvis inom lärplattformar och interna kommunikationskanaler.
* Bidra till utvecklingen av Learning & Performance arbetssätt för att stärka lärande och prestation i hela organisationen.


 För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Flerårig erfarenhet i en senior learning-roll, med dokumenterad erfarenhet av lärandedesign, performance management och upskilling inom IT/Tech.
* God förståelse för tekniska grundbegrepp och vana att arbeta nära roller som systemutvecklare, arkitekter, data scientists, lean-agila ledare, AI engineers, IT-säkerhets- och cloud-specialister.
* Erfarenhet av att driva kompetensförflyttning i större och komplexa organisationer.
* Stark förmåga att koppla kompetensutveckling till verksamhetsmål och strategiska prioriteringar, med tydligt kund- och användarperspektiv.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att facilitera workshops, dialoger och grupprocesser.
* Stark projektledningsförmåga och vana att samarbeta med många olika intressenter.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i eller nära lean-agila organisationer, gärna med förståelse för SAFe eller liknande ramverk.


 Det är meriterande om du också har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från managementkonsultroll eller liknande förändringsnära uppdrag.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med lärplattformar (LMS/LXP).
* God förståelse för AI-teknologier och deras användning i lärande, såsom generativ AI, prompt engineering och AI-stödda lärvägar.
* Erfarenhet av people analytics, exempelvis via Power BI eller Python.
* Erfarenhet av att bygga och förvalta samarbeten med externa lärande- och tech-partners, exempelvis Microsoft, Pluralsight eller LMS/LXP-leverantörer.
* Vana av att använda engelska i affärssammanhang, både muntligt och skriftligt.


 Du kombinerar ett strategiskt helhetsperspektiv med stark operativ genomförandekraft. Du är lika bekväm med att sätta riktning och struktur som att själv kavla upp ärmarna och bygga lösningar i praktiken. Du trivs i miljöer där allt inte är färdig definierat, har lätt för att prioritera i komplexitet och skapar förtroende genom samarbete, tydlighet och leverans.
   

  

 Du är målmedveten, pragmatisk och noggrann, och tycker om att arbeta tillsammans med andra för att förvandla idéer till handling. Din positiva inställning och lösningsfokus gör dig till en uppskattad kollega i en organisation som ständigt utvecklas.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter:**
 Rekryterande chef: maja.wikstrom@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: susanne.hirsch2@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: anna.sandqvist@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund. Genom självstyrande agila team och fokus på kundernas behov utvecklar vi innovativa tekniska lösningar och skapar framtidens kundupplevelse.
   

  

 Hos oss värdesätts samarbete, öppenhet och mångfald, och vi tror att olika perspektiv är nyckeln till lärande och innovation. Vi ger dig tryggheten att vara modig, bidra med nya idéer och påverka både din egen och företagets utveckling.

title: Senior Game Developer
description:
**This is Coody**
 We’re one of Sweden’s fastest-growing tech consultancies, expanding in both people and revenue. We attribute our growth to our simple yet powerful approach to Gravity-Free Consulting, combining the freedom and flexibility of freelancing with the security of traditional employment.
   

  

 At Coody, we believe in freedom, trust, and ambition which means you’ll feel like a freelancer with free rein on assignments that excite you, while enjoying the benefits of being employed by a company that invests in your growth.
   

  

 Our senior sales team has built a vast, carefully curated client network, enabling our consultants to work with some of the most innovative companies in Sweden, Finland, the US, and the UK across Gaming, Fintech, Medtech, AI, SaaS, Aviation, and Automotive, tackling real technical challenges while shaping their own career paths.
   

  

 We’re a
 **diverse community of ambitious tech professionals** 
 , representing more than
 **14 nationalities** 
 .
   

  

**Coody is more of a platform than a traditional consultancy** 
 . Everything we do is designed to help you work and live according to your own priorities and ambitions. If you’re curious to see how this works in practice,
 **explore our Employee Handbook** 
 and discover a company that truly puts consultants first.
   

  

**Why Coody**
 At Coody, we cut out everything unnecessary to give more back to you as a consultant. And we have done it in the package of a lean and efficient organization, meaning no overpaid managers, no fancy offices and no extravagant conferences. Instead we give you:
   

  

**Maximized Compensation.** 
 Typically a +40% salary increase.
   

  

**Freedom & Flexibility** 
 . No bosses. All digital. Fully remote for those who prefer.
   

  

**Employment Security.** 
 High salary, pension, insurance, paid vacation and a big educational fund.
   

  

**Shape the Future.** 
 Projects and assignments for digital game changers like Spotify, Hemnet, Visa, Tobii, Toca Boca, Mojang, Flightradar24, SJ, and exciting startups and scaleups.
   

  

****What you’ll be doing****
 As a consultant in Game Development at Coody, you’ll have the opportunity to work with some of the most inspiring digital entertainment companies in the world, in fields such as Games, AR/VR, Music, and other forms of interactive media. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, artists, producers, and product managers.
   

  

 You’ll need to be adaptable and ready to hit the ground running in new environments. We see every challenge as an opportunity to grow. Typically, you’ll work on 1-2 assignments per year for companies in industries that you’re passionate about.
   

  

****Who you are****
 We’re after talented game developers who love to build immersive experiences and bring ideas to life. You thrive in fast-paced environments, enjoy pushing technical boundaries, and want the freedom to work on exciting projects - without the corporate nonsense.
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in software development.
* Hands-on experience with building games, VR/AR, or similar interactive experiences.
* Solid skills in modern C++, Lua, AngelScript, or similar.
* Experience from Unreal Engine (a bonus).
* A relevant degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Game Development, or similar.
* Based in Sweden - You must have Swedish citizenship, a valid work visa, or permanent residency.
* Fluent in English (spoken and written)


****How to apply****
 Excited to take the next step in your career and work on meaningful client assignments? Apply now, and we’ll be in touch shortly.

title: Channel Account Manager
description:
🏆 Come and join
 **Pax8** 
 ,
 **Microsoft's Global Partner of the Year 2024** 
 , as a
 **Business Development Manager** 
 , based in
 **Stockholm, Sweden** 
 in our stellar Sales Team
 **.** 
**🚀**
 It's an exciting time to become part of Pax8 Sweden as we enter the next significant stage of our incredible growth. This role offers immense opportunities to make an impact, build your legacy, and contribute to our mission.
   

  

**📍 Hybrid Role | Based in Stockholm | Travel across Sweden & Europe required**
**Your Mission as our Channel Account Manager**
 As a cloud and marketplace expert, you will identify and understand customer business objectives, providing solutions to address their pain points and ultimately enable growth within their business also.
   

  

 Take ownership of the sales cycle, from identifying prospects to closing new business, with a focus on driving revenue and increasing Pax8 market share.
   

  

 You will utilise the Pax8 sales methodology to manage sales funnels and build strategic relationships with partners.
   

  

**🚀
 *We are a high growth US company with significant investment in international markets within EMEA and APAC. We are the best in class with YOY growth in consecutive years from start up in EMEA.***
**🚀**
**Learn more about our journey and achievements by checking out these articles:**
* Exciting Times at Pax8- meet our new CEO
* Pax8 recognised as Microsoft Partner of the year 2024
* Pax8 unveils next Generation Marketplace Experience
* Exciting Times - meet our new CEO
* Pax8 Nordic Expansion


 We win awards for our people's hard work and the positive experiences they have while doing it. For that reason, we are proud to have just been certified as a
 **'Great Place to Work'** 
 .
   

  

**As a Channel Account Manager, your day to day includes:**
* Serving as a cloud technology expert providing business solutions to resolve pain points for our partners
* Understanding partners business objectives and identify best solutions
* Expanding our partner network through partner acquisition and active involvement in events.
* Managing your sales cycle, identifying prospects and closing new business with the primary goal of driving revenue and increasing Pax8 market share
* Building relationships with our partner sales teams and strategizing on new sales opportunities
* Supporting other Channel Account Managers and sharing those wins as a team


**Culturally you’ll be comfortable in, and perhaps come from, a complex, fast growing technology business.**
**You'll be the ideal Channel Account Manager for us if you:**
* are an excellent Swedish speaker with proficient English language skills, both written and spoken.
* have demonstrated sales/account management experience in the channel or in IT Sales e.g. Software as a Service
* have an interest in cloud technology products and services and can demonstrate a solid understanding of business technology
* are a storyteller and team player
* embrace an authentic approach to selling within a team environment, with a commitment to achieving outstanding sales results
* bring resilience and drive — this is a fast-paced, results-driven environment where ambition pays off
* are willing to travel across Sweden and abroad


 To fulfil this role you should be resident in this country with a valid right to work.
   

  

**We encourage you to apply for a role at Pax8 even if you don’t meet 100% of the bullet points! We believe in cultivating an environment where is are a diversity of perspectives.**
 We take pride in our diverse and multicultural work environment, where communication is key. Our team collectively speaks more than 23 languages, reflecting the richness of our global community.
   

  

 We review and acknowledge every application using real humans - Our Talent team are based in the UK and Netherlands - Please look out for a response from us to your application in your inbox but check spam too!
   

  

 If you struggle to get “time out” we’re happy to accommodate early/late conversations and interview times or if you have any queries you can ring the Talent Partner, Victoria, managing this role on +44 117 457 7913. (No Agencies Please)
   

  

**Pax8 Working Environment & Benefits**
* OTE salary of up to SEK 615,000 gross yearly (depending on experience)
* Long term Incentive Plan (Stock Options after qualified period)
* Dedicated time for training and personal development
* Health & Wellbeing coaching support
* Regular trips to our European offices
* Social and community events


**What's in it for you?**
 Pax8 is a learning accelerant. If you are
 **growth minded and curious** 
 , there’s plenty of scope for talented individuals to progress quickly in this opportunity or to other internal options (internal mobility in 2023 was 34%) as we grow and expand. We have our very own internal "Elev8" Academy, Pax8 University & LinkedIn Learning for personal development plus access to Learning & Development specialist trainers and extensive "born in the cloud" mentors available for your growth. We’ll provide the opportunity, stretch and projects to help you thrive and see exactly what you need to achieve to get to the next level.
   

  

**Why Pax8?**
 Pax8 is the technology marketplace of the future, linking partners, vendors, and small to midsized businesses (SMBs) through AI-powered insights and comprehensive product support. With a global partner ecosystem of over 35,000 managed service providers, Pax8 empowers SMBs worldwide by providing software and services that unlock their growth potential and enhance their security. Committed to innovating cloud commerce at scale, Pax8 drives customer acquisition and solution consumption across its entire ecosystem.
   

  

 As part of our hiring process, we are required to undertake information verification checks on all candidates that are successful in their application with Pax8. As part of these checks Pax8 will request ID verification, reference requests and qualification checks (additional checks will be completed for UK candidates only, such as criminal and financial). All checks are completed by our third-party provider, Vero. Once checks have been completed all candidates will receive a copy for their records.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities**
 Pax8 are an equal opportunities employer and welcome individuals who are in possession of the appropriate requirements to work within the country the role is based in. Offered individuals will be asked to undertake identity, security compliance and reference checks. Your privacy is important to us. Your data will be held in accordance with GDPR best practices and processed only in accordance with our recruiting processes.
   

  

 Job Applicant Privacy Notice (https://www.pax8.com/en-us/terms/job-applicant-privacy-notice/)
   

  

**#IND-LP**

title: Junior Designer Menswear Woven
description:
As part of the Design Team, as Junior Designer, you will be involved in assisting in designing & developing the woven categories, together with the Category Designer and in close collaboration with the Product Developer.
   

  

* Assist the Designer in designing and executing the woven assortment, according to creative and business direction and within the Gant DNA constantly in mind.
* Support in selection of material and trims related to the seasonal direction
* Assist with trim, print, fabric and colour approvals
* Research trends and commercial newness within product category
* Understanding the relevance of how the assortment connects to the collection layers and fullfill the consumer segmentations
* Support in securing product excellence throughout the full design process from sketch to sms delivery
* Work according to the Critical Path and be organised to meet deadlines
* Preparing and updating artworks, overviews, preparing sourcing documents and updating articles in the PLM system
* Support the Design Manager with administrative preparations of the Seasonal Directions
* Degree in Fashion Design
* Preferably 2 years of experience in a similar role
* Proficient in Adobe Suite: Illustrator (Ai), Photoshop (Ps), InDesign (In)
* Proficient with PowerPoint, Excel, and preferably PLM systems
* Familiarity with Clo3D is a benefit
* Agile and open to feedback, with a growth-oriented mindset
* Demonstrates strong creativity, trend awareness, and commercial acumen
* Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple tasks without losing sight of the big picture
* Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and contributing to a collaborative team
* Strong communication skills and fluency in English, both written and spoken, is essential


**This is a temporary position with a duration of approximately between 26/04/01 and 26/12/31.**
 Apply with your CV, portfolio, and motivation in English by 2026/02/28. Please attach your portfolio as part of your application, as it is essential for the review process. Our team reviews applications on a rolling basis, so seize the opportunity to join us by submitting your application today! Please note that the position may be filled before the set end date.

title: D365 F&O Consultant
description:
Our international client is looking for a D365 F&O Consultant to join their team for a freelance B2B contract. They need someone who can start ASAP, and the initial contract is due to last 12 months with a good chance of extension beyond that. This position is hybrid, with 3 days a week on-site in Stockholm and 2 days remote.
 



  





**Project details**



* Position: D365 F&O Consultant
* Contract type: B2B
* Contract Length: 12 Months
* Location: Hybrid in Stockholm (3 days on-site and 2 days remote)
* Languages: English



  





**Core Tasks**



* Prepare, organize, and support functional workshops
* Configure D365 environments according to project and business needs
* Lead or co-lead workshops with business and project stakeholders
* Maintain and update project-related information in DevOps
* Document workshop outcomes and meeting minutes
* Perform functional testing and support issue resolution
* Assist key users with project-related tasks and system usage



  





**Required Qualifications & Skills**



* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Dynamics 365, with a solid understanding of business process-driven system functionality
* Proven ability to manage change and support local teams through process and system transformation
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate with diverse stakeholders and clearly explain technical concepts
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify process inefficiencies and propose optimised system solutions



  





 If this is something you are interested in, please send me an up-to-date CV, and we can discuss the role in more detail. Otherwise, what is it you're looking for? If you know someone who might be interested, please forward this advert their way

title: Revenue Enablement Associate
description:
**About Atlar**
 Money is the lifeblood of business and the tools for managing it are overdue for an upgrade. We're changing the way businesses manage money by providing a radical new way. And this change is happening fast – less than three years after launch, Atlar is used by companies such as Trustly, Tide, Acne Studios, GetYourGuide, and Zilch to manage over €1bn in annualized payments volume.
   

  

 Atlar is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and backed by Index Ventures, investors in category defining companies such as Adyen, Revolut, Figma, and more.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Atlar is looking for a Revenue Enablement Associate to help us build and scale our revenue engine.
   

  

 You will own the operational backbone of our commercial team, making sure everyone has what they need to bring in new high-quality opportunities, close deals and scale fast.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Remove Friction for the BDR Team: Act as the first point of contact for rep queries. Whether you're building a specific report or troubleshooting a tool bug, you ensure nothing slows down our outbound engine.
* Fuel the Sales Pipeline: Build high-precision target lists using tools like Clay, Sales Navigator, and Apollo. You’ll ensure our sales team is always focused on the highest-leverage opportunities in the market.
* Optimize GTM Processes: Work directly with the GTM team to identify process gaps, surface "what’s broken," and design the fixes or improvements needed to scale.
* Drive Enablement & Adoption: Ensure the BDR team fully utilizes available resources and tools, fostering a culture of continuous learning and operational excellence.
* Innovate with AI & Automation: Proactively identify manual tasks that can be handled smarter with AI or automation, then pilot and roll out internal solutions to boost performance.


 What You Need
   

  

* You can build strong, collaborative relationships with your colleagues. You’re a team player who wins by helping others win.
* You’re proactive and are relentless in the pursuit of answers.
* You are curious and enjoy figuring things out. You don’t wait for things to happen, you make them happen.
* You can prioritize effectively and get things done in a fast-paced startup environment.
* You are detail-oriented and understand that a CRM is only as good as the data inside it.
* You have a deep interest in understanding how business and sales work.


**Nice-to-Haves**
* a Bachelor's degree from a recognized university.
* Experience working in high-growth startups.
* Strong skills in Excel or Google Sheets.
